basics.name: Aaron Remedios
basics.label: M.S. Robotics Engineering | Embedded Systems • Robotics • Photonics
basics.summary: Robotics engineer with strong foundations in embedded systems, autonomous robots, perception, and electromechanical system design. Experienced in developing full-stack robotic systems spanning PCB design, firmware, ROS2-based autonomy, perception pipelines, and mechanical integration. Currently pursuing an M.S. in Robotics Engineering at Purdue University.

education.area: Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering (Honors in Data Science)

work.summary: Designed and deployed autonomous robotic systems for industrial inspection and cleaning applications.
highlights: Designed a compact pipe-inspection robot for sub-50 mm pipelines using ESP32 and a custom 4-layer PCB.
Implemented EKF-based sensor fusion and dead-reckoning for accurate localization.
Developed sonar-based mapping for sewer-cleaning robots to detect obstructions and pipe geometry.
Built a sewer-cleaning robot integrating hydraulics controlled via Raspberry Pi 5.
Designed high-voltage AC electronics for an autonomous solar panel placement robot.

work.company: Cosmo Logistic Theme — e-Yantra Robotics Competition (IIT Bombay)
work.summary: Engineered an autonomous warehouse logistics system integrating a mobile robot and robotic arm.
highlights: Developed a complete ROS2-based autonomy stack using Nav2 for path planning and localization.
Integrated UR5 robotic arm using MoveIt2 for precise pick-and-place operations.
Implemented OpenCV-based ArUco marker detection for box localization and pose estimation.
Coordinated mobile manipulation tasks for seamless warehouse logistics automation.

work.summary: Built a six-wheel Mars-mission rover for rugged terrain exploration.
highlights: Designed a rocker–bogie suspension system with 3D-printed TPU wheels for enhanced traction on soft sand.
Developed a custom ESP32-based control PCB for six-wheel locomotion.
Implemented PID control for smooth and stable motion across uneven terrain.
Deployed OpenCV for test-tube detection and vision-based task execution.
Integrated LiDAR, camera, and IMU data for robust navigation in unstructured environments.

work.summary: Designed and managed development of multi-robot systems for competitive robotics challenges.
highlights: Designed robots capable of passing and shooting balls at a Lagori tower and rebuilding the structure.
Developed pneumatic mechanisms using solenoid valves controlled via ESP32 microcontrollers.
Integrated LiDAR sensors to estimate distance and optimized distance-to-power mapping for tower knockdown.
Built two stair-climbing robots using STM32-based controllers with custom 2-layer PCBs.
Implemented PID-based locomotion and sensor-feedback loops for accurate distance, angle, and projectile control.

work.summary: Led end-to-end development of an automated industrial chamfering system.
highlights: Designed and deployed an automated chamfering machine that reduced gear chipping by ~85%.
Used Raspberry Pi as the main controller and designed all mechanical components in SolidWorks.
Developed a React.js based HMI and implemented an algorithm to compute chamfer angles from rack geometry.

work.summary: Designed embedded electronics for electric vehicle conversion systems.
highlights: Designed an EV conversion kiosk with HMI, NFC authentication, GPS tracking, and backend integration.
Reverse-engineered a commercial ESC and developed a cost-reduced in-house controller (~40% cost reduction).
Implemented three custom PPM-based motor control modes.
